content: I am an associate researcher (Principal Investigator) at the Institute of Advanced Agricultural Sciences, Peking University. I apply modeling and quantitative methods to study markets with primary focuses on agricultural, food, and resource markets. I obtained my PhD in Agricultural and Resource Economics from University of California, Davis under the guidance of Prof. Richard J. Sexton and Prof. Rachael E. Goodhue.
summary: I am an associate researcher (Principal Investigator) at the Institute of Advanced Agricultural Sciences, Peking University. I apply modeling and quantitative methods to study markets with primary focuses on agricultural, food, and resource markets.
title: Yujing (Megan) Song

summary: Using detailed transaction-level data of a large wholesale produce market in China, this paper explores the value of relational contracting alongside an active spot market and suggests the strategic complementarity between the two.
title: Relational Contracts in Well-Functioning Markets: Evidence from China's Vegetable Wholesale

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   --
summary: We review the theoretical and empirical literatures on market power in dynamic models of markets for renewable and non-renewable natural resources.
title: Market Power in Dynamic Models of Natural Resource Markets: Theory, Empirics, and the Lerner Index

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   --
summary: We apply the Rausser-Simon multilateral bargaining model to a specific negotiation process, involving water storage capacity and use in the upper part of the Adour Basin in south-western France.
title: Structure and Power in Multilateral Negotiations: An Application to French Water Policy

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   --
summary: In 2017, 38,200 acres of California strawberries generated $3.1 billion in production value, making it one of the state’s top ten crops. Strawberry production ramps up in March and is at its peak in April through June. At press time, much of this period has been impacted by COVID-19-related restrictions that have been in place nationally and internationally, making the potential impacts relatively large in terms of the share of annual production affected.
title: How is the Strawberry Industry Weathering the Pandemic?
